| HistoryText             = 
===Origin===
The Myrmidons were a tribe of fierce warriors, descended from [[Myrmidon (Earth-616)|King Myrmidon]] of [[Phtiotis]], the son of [[Zeus Panhellenios (Earth-616)|Zeus]] and of the Phthiotisian princess [[Eurymedousa (Earth-616)|Eurydemousa]].<!-- {{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 9|; Appendix: Olympians: Demi-Gods, Heroes and other Graeco-Roman Mythological Figures: Myrmidons' entry}} -->

Their patron god was [[Ares (Earth-616)|Ares]].{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 9|; Appendix: Olympians: Demi-Gods, Heroes and other Graeco-Roman Mythological Figures: Myrmidons' entry}}

===Peleus' rule===
They were led by the Myrmidon king [[Peleus (Earth-616)|Peleus]].{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 8|; Appendix: Olympians: Demi-Gods, Heroes and other Graeco-Roman Mythological Figures: [[Achilles (Greek Legend) (Earth-616)|Achilles]]' entry}}

===[[Trojan War]]===
At the beginning of the [[Trojan War]], led by [[Achilles (Earth-616)|Achilles]], they went to [[Mount Ida (Turkey)|Mount Ida]] and drove off the cattle of [[Dardanus|Dardanian]] [[Aeneas (Earth-616)|Aeneas]], causing Dardanus to join the war against the Achaeans.{{r|Trojan War Vol 1 2}}

Achilles' men ravaged many other cities, including [[Lyrnessus]], [[Pedasus]] and [[Chryse]].{{r|Trojan War Vol 1 2}}<!-- 

[[Neoptolemus (Earth-616)|Neoptolemus]]...{{r|Trojan War Vol 1 4}} -->

===Olympus===
After Achilles' death, he and the Myrmidons were resurrected as [[demigods]], and continued to do the bidding of Ares, their patron god.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 9|; Appendix: Olympians: Demi-Gods, Heroes and other Graeco-Roman Mythological Figures: Myrmidons' entry}}

When [[Amatsu-Mikaboshi (Earth-616)|Mikaboshi]]'s demon army assaulted Olympus, they were the vanguard,{{r|Ares Vol 1 2}} led by Achilles.{{r|Ares Vol 1 3}}

Others were tasked by [[Zeus Panhellenios (Earth-616)|Zeus]] with abducting and protecting [[Alexander Aaron (Earth-616)|Alex Aaron]], son of [[Ares (Earth-616)|Ares]], in order to draw the God of War to Olympus to battle Mikaboshi.{{r|Ares Vol 1 2}}

Accompanying Achilles, two Myrmidons went to Earth and returned with Ares, only to find their city destroyed and their brothers dead. Fighting the Eastern demons alongside with Ares and Achilles, they were all eventually teleported to the halls of Zeus.{{r|Ares Vol 1 2}} Regrouping, there were only three surviving Myrmidons.{{r|Ares Vol 1 3}}

| Notes                   = * Unlike [[Peleus (Earth-616)|Peleus]], the Myrmidon king, neither his son [[Achilles (Earth-616)|Achilles]] nor Achilles' son [[Neoptolemus (Earth-616)|Neoptolemus]] were stated to be Myrmidons, but only to lead them. Similarly, [[Patroclus (Earth-616)|Patroclus]] was seen with Achilles and the Myrmidons, but not stated to be a member.
